definition: property (such as securities) pledged by a borrower to protect the interests of the lender
a branch of a bodily part (such as a vein)
informational materials (such as brochures and fact sheets) used in selling a product or service to a prospective customer or buyer
examples: Attendees can expect to make approximately 50 new business contacts and should … have an ample supply of business cards, marketing collateral and anything else to help potential leads remember them.

definition: accompanying as secondary or subordinate : concomitant

examples: no direct objection, but a few collateral ones

definition: serving to support or reinforce : ancillary
examples: collateral evidence was presented at the trial

definition: belonging to the same ancestral stock but not in a direct line of descent — compare lineal sense 3a
examples: Brothers, cousins, uncles, and nephews are collateral kinsmen.

definition: parallel, coordinate, or corresponding in position, order, time, or significance
examples: collateral states like Athens and Sparta

definition: of, relating to, or being collateral used as security (as for payment of a debt or performance of a contract)

examples: a collateral loan secured by stocks and bonds deposited with the lender
